summary:
Product and growth operator with 20+ years building, scaling, and exiting physical and digital products. I’ve taken companies from low seven figures to $7M+ revenue, led GTM, manufacturing, IP, licensing, and built teams that execute under pressure. I thrive in high-ambiguity, high-growth environments and I’m usually brought in when things need to move fast, scale cleanly, and actually ship.

Discover. Design. Create. Inspire.
headline: Product innovation and strategy

educations.description: Furthered my knowledge and passion for design.

position.title: Director of Product
position.description:
Consumer goods company that brings fun to any gathering with kitschy drinkware 

- Leading product innovation and development that has resulted in revenue growth from $1.2m to $7.5m in 2.5 yrs. Landing Inc 5000 #132 and #12 in the US for consumer products.

- Overhauled v1 product line by improving overall product features and quality, relaunching the full brand with 100+ new skus during a global pandemic.

- GTM lead, responsible for the end-to-end product development cycle and cross department collaboration on key milestones from concept through commercialization. 

- Ideated and executed in house product customization engine, resulting in partnerships from professional sports organizations to global brands, adding $250k in revenue year one.

- Developed and launched brands first licensing programs along with new category product expansion strategy.

- Oversaw patent filing and management, receiving 1 utility and 11 design patents, protecting our IP in domestic and international markets

position.title: Manager, Special Programs
position.description:
Technology company transforming footwear, apparel, and wearables for every human body. Wiivv Insoles and Sandals are created uniquely for each person, based on measurements taken from the award-winning Wiivv mobile app.

- Managed and scaled Wiivv’s R&D manufacturing facility and resources to handle at scale production capacity for Wiivv and partners.

- Reduced production time by 60%, creating and applying patented manufacturing methodologies for scaling. This was achieved through overall part reduction, finishing processes and a proprietary 3D graphic printing process.
  
- Secured $3.5m government funding to build an Advanced R&D facility in Vancouver through BC’s Business Scale up Program.

- Led product strategy on bringing to market Dr. Scholl’s 3D, a white-labeled Wiivv Insoles product for Dr. Scholl’s, Wiivv’s largest strategic partner. Dr. Scholl’s 3D earned the highest comfort scores from consumers in Dr. Scholl’s history.

- Led design, development, and execution for Wiivv’s Lululemon Seawheeze experience in 2017 - 2019 which brought-to-life the possibility of in-store 3D scanning and custom footwear creation.

position.title: Senior Product Designer & Developer
position.description:
- Invented, designed, and co-engineered patented and award-winning Wiivv Custom Fit Sandals. 2019 Golden A’Design Award in Footwear for Wiivv Custom Fit Sandal

- Responsible for concept through to commercialization of all Wiivv hardware products and customer experiences. 

- Developed instore 3D scan solutions for strategic partner growth in new sales channels.

position.title: Product Design Manager
position.description:
- #6 employee at the early-stage technology startup, I worked with leadership to develop the initial experience, design, and execution across digital and physical products.

- Managed Wiivv’s first generation iOS mobile app, website, and marketing materials.

position.title: Co-Founder
position.location: 1022 West Morena Blvd. Suite H San Diego, CA 92110
position.description:
Southern California’s largest and most comprehensive makerspace. Offering a wide variety of tools and training programs to help students, hobbyists, entrepreneurs, and professionals learn physical product design, development, and ultimately achieve their project goals. 

- I was integral in building all aspects of the businessl; from build out to marketing strategies and partnerships.

- Doubled paying memberships YOY,  growing to 600+ members and over $2M in recurring annual revenue.

- Staffed and managed all makerspace educators, curating programming for Makerplace.

- Staffed and managed customer service team, with a 60%+ MoM member retention rate.

position.title: Co-Owner/Designer/Fabricator
position.description:
Providing clients with unique and innovative product solutions, leveraging advanced manufacturing techniques. 

- Grew the company to over $1M annual revenue with 70% gross profit margin.

- Specialization and profit forward mindset led to an acquisition of the company in 2015.

- SRI became a go-to design and build firm for fortune 500 companies, US military branches, action sports industry companies, architects, and designers.

- Pioneered large-scale advanced manufacturing techniques for laser cut custom grip tape in the skateboard industry

- Developed new method to bulk process laser-cut bathing suit fabric panels for industry leading swimwear companies.

honors.title: Inc 5000 rank 132 , 12 in Product, 1 in Oregon
iF Design Award for Wiivv Custom Fit Sandal
honors.description: Nearly 8 out of 10 Americans experience foot pain, often as a result of wearing wrong-sized shoes. Yet bespoke footwear remains beyond the budgets of most people. Enter the internet and the revolutionary technology of 3D printing, and hey presto, made-to-measure footwear is now available to a mass market. Vancouver-based Wiivv Wearables begin the process with an award-winning smartphone app, which gathers the customer's data and then generates a biomechanically optimized design. This is then 3D printed, assembled, and shipped to the customer within 14 days. Over 12 million data points were used to create the Wiivv Fit algorithm, and Wiivv’s proprietary technologies have reduced the cost of 3D printing by 98.5%. The footbed is 100% closed loop recyclable.

honors.title: Golden A' Design Award in Footwear for Wiivv Custom Fit Sandal
honors.description:
In a world where millions of products and designs launch each year, the A' Design Award is meant to highlight the world's best designs and well-designed products. 

To win the Golden A’ Design Award, a product must have demonstrated “an excellent design that helps people achieve more, by empowering people through added functionality, performance, reliability and interaction.”

The Wiivv Custom Sandal was a shoo-in (pun always intended). With 90% of customers reporting that Wiivvs decrease their foot pain, we have truly exceeded in creating a product that empowers people to move and live their best.

The A' Design Award and Competition is the worlds' largest design competition awarding the best designs, design concepts and products & services. The jury that picks the winners in each category is made up of internationally influential press members, established designers, leading academics and prominent entrepreneurs.
